document_data.caption: ''Two adventurers look upon the stone spindle in the ruins of Ythryn.''
document_data.name: Stone Spindle
document_data.creator: [[Giant]]s of [[Ostoria]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''''stone spindle''''' was an [[artifact]] that originated from the long-lost [[giant]] civilization of [[Ostoria]].
document_data.Description:
The ''stone spindle'' itself comprised gray stone that stood {{SIAdj|10|ft|adj=tall}}. It bore upon its surface strange, unidentified symbols.

It was entirely impervious to physical and magical harm.
document_data.Powers:
While its exact powers were unknown, the relic was capable of "wreaking havoc" upon [[the Weave]] itself. It was capable of at least dispelling the magic of ''[[mythallar]]''s, which were considered among the most powerful magical devices in the Realms.

If a spell of sufficient power were centered upon the spindle, a blast of [[anti-magic]] would release from the relic and extend outward for {{SI|3|mi|k}}. That area would become a [[dead-magic zone]] for a single day and all [[spellcaster]]s within would be unable to cast any prepared spells. Magical constructs, creatures crafted by magical means and [[living spell]]s were not affected by this blast.
document_data.History:
The Spindle was said to have been crafted some time before the [[Days of Thunder]], some 40,000 years before the events of the [[Second Sundering]]. At some point in history, it fell into the depths of the [[Sea of Moving Ice]] in the [[Frozenfar]].

The spindle was uncovered in the {{YearlinkName|-343}}, by [[arcanist]]s of [[Netheril]] and took it aboard the [[Netherese enclave|enclave]] of [[Ythryn]]. The arcanists began to conduct experiments upon the strange giant relic to learn more. Unfortunately, one of the experiments went awry and an anti-magic discharge from the spindle cause the enclave's ''[[mythallar]]'' to malfunction. The flying city plummeted out of the sky and crashed into the icy wastes below. For years, it continued to emit magical radiation that disallowed any spellcasting within a certain radius. 

As of the {{YearlinkName|1489}}, the spindle remained within the [[Spire of Iriolarthas]] within the ruins of Ythryn. It was believed to have been dormant as of that time.
